itemDescription: English rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Edward Sadler (8 May 1910 – 26 December 1992) was an English dual-code international rugby union and rugby league footballer who played in the 1930s and 1940s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for England, and whilst serving with the Royal Corps of Signals for the Army Rugby Union, and representative level rugby league (RL) for England, and at club level for Oldham (Heritage № 296) and Castleford (Heritage № 134). He also appeared for Wigan (Heritage № 459) as a World War II guest player.
